Container.Name: snipe-it
Container.Overview:
This is a FOSS project for asset management in IT Operations. Knowing who has which laptop, when it was purchased in order to depreciate it correctly, handling software licenses, etc.
It is built on Laravel 5.5.
Snipe-IT is actively developed and we release quite frequently. (Check out the live demo here.)
This is web-based software. This means there is no executable file (aka no .exe files), and it must be run on a web server and accessed through a web browser. It runs on any Mac OSX, flavor of Linux, as well as Windows, and we have a Docker image available if that's what you're into.

Config.Name: MySQL Database Name
Config.Description: The name of your Snipe-IT database.

Config.Name: MySQL Username
Config.Description: The MySQL username you set up to access the database.

Config.Name: MySQL Password
Config.Description: Your database password for the userd

Config.Name: MySQL Database Host
Config.Description: The host for your database

Config.Name: MySQL Database Port
Config.Description: Port number of your MySQL Database.

Config.Name: SMTP Address
Config.Description: Specify the hostname for your outgoing mail server. Keep in mind that this server must be accessible from the server you're running Snipe-IT on.

Config.Name: SMTP Port
Config.Description: Set the port number that your mail server expects to send from

Config.Name: SMTP From Address
Config.Description: Specify an email address that is used globally for all e-mails that are sent by your application.

Config.Name: SMTP From Name
Config.Description: Specify the name that should show up in the recipient's inbox when they receive email from your Snipe-IT instance.

Config.Name: SMTP Encryption
Config.Description:
Here you may specify the encryption protocol that should be used when the application sends e-mail messages.
'tls' for SMTP-over-SSL 'tcp' for unencrypted

Config.Name: SMTP Username
Config.Description: Set the username of the authenticated user you'll be sending email as.

Config.Name: SMTP Email Password
Config.Description: Set the password for the authenticated user you'll be sending as.

Config.Name: App Key
Config.Description:
This is a randomly generated key that your system will use to store encrypted data.
Make sure you keep a backup of this value somewhere safe (password manager, etc).

Config.Name: App URL
Config.Description: This is the url to your application, beginning with http:// or https://

Config.Name: App Timezone
Config.Description: Set this to be the timezone you wish your Snipe-IT installation to use. This should use a PHP-supported timezone.

Config.Name: App Locale
Config.Description: Set this to reflect the two-letter or 5-letter abbreviation for the language you'd like to use for Snipe-IT. The default language is US English (en)

Config.Name: Port
Config.Description: Container Port: 80

Config.Name: App Environment
Config.Description: This should always be set to production unless you are a developer who is editing code within snipe-IT.

Config.Name: App Debug
Config.Description: Setting this to true will turn on debugging in your Snipe-IT installation. This can be very useful for debugging, but should NEVER be left to true in a production environment.

Config.Name: Appdata Config Path
Config.Description: Container Path: /config

Config.Name: Data
Config.Description: Container Path: /var/lib/snipeit

Container.Description:
This is a FOSS project for asset management in IT Operations. Knowing who has which laptop, when it was purchased in order to depreciate it correctly, handling software licenses, etc.
It is built on Laravel 5.5.
Snipe-IT is actively developed and we release quite frequently. (Check out the live demo here.)
This is web-based software. This means there is no executable file (aka no .exe files), and it must be run on a web server and accessed through a web browser. It runs on any Mac OSX, flavor of Linux, as well as Windows, and we have a Docker image available if that's what you're into.
